name: At Home in Toronto
description:
What does home mean to you? Discover rarely seen artifacts from the City's collections and items from community members, the exhibition invites you to explore the many ways we define, create, and carry home with us. From a World War One soldier's return ticket home to a precious family object stewarded by multiple generations, you'll encounter belongings, voices, and stories of Toronto artists, makers, entrepreneurs, and community leaders as they share their unique perspectives on belonging, identity, and place. These powerful objects offer fresh, heartfelt perspectives on what it means to find, make, or remember home.  

At Home in Toronto includes the artworks of Rebecca Baird, Carl Beam, Fred Hagan, Robert Houle, Luis Jacob, Kit Li, Raoul Olou, Yasmine Louis, and Natalie Wood, as well as loaned works by Toronto artists Doug Brown and Frantz Brent-Harris.

organizer.name: City of Toronto Museums & Heritage Services

name: Washed Up - Pop-Up Installation at Scarborough Museum
description:
Beginning July 1st at Scarborough Museum, experience Washed Up by Hatecopy. The project captures the essence of liminal spaces that serve as cultural hubs for the South Asian immigrant communities, using the washing machine as a vessel to carry textiles that signify our roots and drawing visitors into an environment that intertwines the past, present, and future; acknowledging the dirty laundry of Canadian History and "Truth," and reclaiming both seen and unseen spaces.

Maria Qamar (b. 1991) is a Toronto-based pop artist whose work is focused in the South Asian diaspora and immigrant communities and their cultural experiences. The work specializes in themes regarding feminism, social change, humour, pop culture, politics and romance. The artist has been recognized both nationally and internationally with exhibits and features in the Museum of Contemporary Arts, the National Arts Centre, Sotheby's, Phillips Auction, and the AGO.

name: Home Beyond Walls: Summer Fun at Scarborough Museum
description:
If walls could speak, what stories would they tell? Join the fun and  engage in joyful placemaking with a variety of hands-on, minds-on activities, within and beyond Scarborough Museum's buildings and grounds.

If you enjoy a guided experience, museum staff are stationed to help navigate the museum site and its activities.

name: 100% Wizard with Keith Brown

location.name: Tallulah's Cabaret at Buddies in Bad Times

description:
Award-winning family-friendly magic and storytelling. 

Keith Brown is the two-time Critic's Choice Best Magic Show Orlando 2024, 2023 winner and the two-time Orlando Sentinel Best of Fest 2023, 2024 winner. He's been selected as the Best Magic Show in Winnipeg 2023, and Patron's Pick Edmonton Fringe 2024. 

Lauded by the likes of Joe Thornton, NHL, Dave Grohl, and Eliza Reid the First Lady of Iceland.

name: College Park After Hours
description:
Experience the ultimate midweek escape with free outdoor movies, live music, and pop-up markets right in the heart of Downtown Yonge. For four special Wednesday nights, College Park comes alive with community energy, delicious eats, and open-air entertainment.

Start your evening at the on-site Maker's Market and Bike Clinic, grab a bite from your favourite local restaurant, and enjoy a pre-show concert before the big screen lights up in the evening. Whether you're planning a date night, a family hangout, or a chill solo outing, make us your new Wednesday night tradition.
